questions.question-text: Name, the term used to identify a person.
Age, the number of years a person has lived.
Hometown, the city or place where a person was born or raised.
Hobby, activities a person enjoys doing in their free time.
Job / Occupation, the work or profession someone does.
Family, the group of people related by blood or marriage, like parents and siblings.
Personality, the characteristics that define a person’s behaviour and attitude.
Special Skill, something a person is especially good at.
School, an institution where people go to learn.
Hobby, activities a person enjoys doing in their free time.
What is the Korean word for 'Hello'?
questions.question-answer: 안녕 ahn-nyung, 감사합니다 gam-sa-ham-ni-da, 미안해요 mi-an-hae-yo, 잘 가요 jal ga-yo

questions.question-text: How do you say 'Thank you' in Korean?
questions.question-answer: 미안해요 mi-an-hae-yo, 안녕하세요 ahn-nyung-ha-se-yo, 감사합니다 gam-sa-ham-ni-da, 주세요 ju-se-yo

questions.question-text: When would you say '미안해요 (mi-an-hae-yo)' in Korean?
questions.question-answer: When greeting someone, When thanking someone, When apologizing, When asking for help

questions.question-text: How do you say 'How are you?' in Korean?
questions.question-answer: 뭐예요? mwo-ye-yo?, 어떻게 지내세요? uh-ttuh-ke ji-nae-se-yo?, 언제 만나요? uhn-je man-na-yo?, 어디에 가세요? uh-di-eh ga-se-yo?

questions.question-text: Which is the correct Korean word for 'Please'?
questions.question-answer: 제발 je-bal, 어서 오세요 uh-suh o-se-yo, 주세요 ju-se-yo, 잠깐만요 jam-kkan-man-yo

questions.question-text: In what situation would you say '잘 자요 (jal ja-yo)' in Korean?
questions.question-answer: In the morning, At lunch, In the evening, At night

questions.question-text: What is the correct Korean expression for 'Goodbye'?
questions.question-answer: 안녕히 가세요 ahn-nyung-hi ga-se-yo, 안녕히 주무세요 ahn-nyung-hi ju-mu-se-yo, 만나서 반가워요 man-na-suh ban-ga-wo-yo, 천만에요 chun-man-eh-yo

questions.question-text: How do you say 'Nice to meet you' in Korean?
questions.question-answer: 안녕하세요 ahn-nyung-ha-se-yo, 잘 가요 jal ga-yo, 만나서 반가워요 man-na-suh ban-ga-wo-yo, 어떻게 지내세요? uh-ttuh-ke ji-nae-se-yo

questions.question-text: How do you say 'Where is the bathroom?' in Korean?
questions.question-answer: 화장실 어디예요? hwa-jang-shil uh-di-ye-yo?, 어디 가세요? uh-di ga-se-yo?, 화장실 가요? hwa-jang-shil ga-yo?, 여기 앉아요? yuh-gi an-ja-yo?

questions.question-text: How do you say 'Can I get some water?' in Korean?
questions.question-answer: 물 주세요 mul ju-se-yo,  물 있어요? mul i-sseo-yo?, 물 좀 드세요 mul jom deu-se-yo, 물 가세요 mul ga-se-yo
